title: Alejandro Valverde wins stage 6 of the Critérium du Dauphiné
content:
Alejandro Valverde (Movistar) won stage 6 of the Critérium du Dauphiné ahead of Tao Geoghegan Hart (Ineos Grenadiers) and Patrick Konrad (Bora-Hansgrohe). Alexey Lutsenko (Astana-Premier Tech) took over the general classification, 8 seconds ahead of his teammate Ion Izagirre.

The stage was billed as mountainous but did not do as much damage to the general classification as anticipated. The yellow jersey worn by Lukas Postlberger (Bora-Hansgrohe) was distanced on the penultimate climb and lost his grip on the overall lead.

Geoghegan Hart followed in the footsteps of his teammate Geraint Thomas on stage 5 and tried a solo attack with 300 meters to go but was brought back by Valverde who took the stage win.

Critérium du Dauphiné (2.UWT) Loriol-sur-Drome → Le Sappey-en-Chartreuse
author: Abby Mickey
